text: hi guys I'm Laura Vitale on this episode
of Laura in the kitchen I'm going to
show you how to make my banana chocolate
chip muffins they're incredibly easy to
make just take a few ingredients that
you probably already have on hand and
it's a great used to make of those like
overripe bananas that you know you
probably already have in your fridge so
now to make this recipe you're going to
need three ripe bananas some all-purpose
flour eggs granulated sugar chocolate
chips vegetable oil ground cinnamon salt
baking powder baking soda and vanilla
extract now this is going to be a really
fast recipe and they are so incredibly
delicious
now first thing you want to do is
pre-heat your oven to 400 degrees get
that ready the good thing you wanna do
is take a muffin pan 12 muffins
line the actual pan with little muffin
liners so that this is Shores that the
muffins come out easy and perfect they
don't stick to anything now I can put
this recipe because of my fear of
throwing anything away I want to waste
things so when you have I love bananas
but how many of us go to the store and
buy those like five pound bananas that
are delicious but after three or four
days they start to go Brown and once
that happens they're not exactly
appealing to eat on their own but they
are incredible for cooking and baking
they are so sweet and becoming super
sweet and they're really soft which
means that whatever you're putting them
in are going to be it's gonna be really
moist so whenever you're baking with
bananas you want to make sure you use a
knife right banana otherwise it's going
to be tough to mash them up and they're
not going to be really sweet so in a
large bowl I'm just putting my bananas
in there and now using a fork now this
is really soft now at this point see
that this is exactly what we want I'm
just going to mash these up until you
have like um like a mushy mushy white
consistency this is exactly what we're
looking for perfect consistency you
still want some chunks in there because
I want to be able to bite down on it and
know that it's you know pieces of
bananas now before we do anything else
with that I'm going to set it aside
because to this bowl this little bowl
here I'm gonna put my chocolate chips
these are just regular milk chocolate
chips whatever I ever had
works with about a quarter cup about
three tablespoons of the flour mixture
because once we coat all the chocolate
chips with the flour it prevents them
from sinking to the bottom of the actual
muffin this way we ensure that we have
chocolate chips running all the way
through so now that that's done move
this back here perfect just like so now
we're going to add all of our wet
ingredients to the mushed up bananas
which is about a half a cup of vegetable
oil and this is going to look kind of
funky but I promise it comes together
beautifully some vanilla extract not too
much about a quarter teaspoon
I'm also going to get my eggs in here
now remember I always like to crack my
eggs in a separate bowl just in case you
get a bad egg you don't waste your
entire batter one goes in last egg and
now using a whisk I'm just combining my
wet ingredients and this is so fast and
easy now to this we're going to add our
sugar your regular granulated sugar mix
so it's all incorporated now I have my
flour and my remaining dry ingredients
in here I like to use cinnamon in this
because number one cinnamon goes really
good with bananas obviously and number
two whenever I'm making anything with
chocolate chips or whatever I like to
always put something in there that
really enhances that chocolate flavor
and cinnamon is one of those things I
usually use cinnamon or if I'm making an
old chocolate batter I like to put a
little bit of instant coffee and you
don't taste a coffee but that really
makes that chocolate decadent and
delicious now last thing we're going to
add is our chocolate chip and flour
mixture we're just going to mix this in
to get them incorporated not using a
large ice cream scoop I'm just going to
scoop these into my muffin liners
last one here we go these are going to
go into your preheated oven 400 degrees
for about 18 to 20 minutes at the
18-minute mark take a toothpick insert
it into the middle of the muffin if it
comes out clean with no wet batter on it
you know it's done if at the 18 minute
mark there's just like still crumbs on
that toothpick it means it needs to cook
a little bit more so after that you
check it every two minutes to ensure
we're not over baking them
I took my muffins out about 15 minutes
ago they bake for 18 minutes at 400
degrees and they smell heavenly now you
know the most important part is taste
and I almost dropped one but did it I
caught it got it it look really moist
just gonna open one up look at that
chocolate oh it's like banana bread and
chocolate muffins fell in love had a
baby you have banana muffins with
chocolate chips it's so good they're so
sweet
partly because of the sugar but most of
that sweetness comes from those ripe
bananas remember when they're starting
to look Brown and ugly don't get rid of
them it's like a diamond in the rough
they are so incredible to bake with to
get in your kitchen make these bad boys
and I guarantee you're going to love
